page.title: 03Place Names, Church Lench.
page.content: The only habitation in the area is in several small villages known collectively as THE LENCHES . The term ' Lench ', which is not confined to Worcestershire, is an ancient name for a slope or a hillside. Ab Lench :Locally known as Ob Lench.Probably a derivative of Abba, a common Anglo-Saxon surname. Church Lench :So called because the church of Evesham held considerable interests there. Atch Lench :lying to the East of Church Lench, the word Atch is a corruption of Ast or East Lench Sheriffs Lench :Probably got its name from having been the property of Ursa, one time sheriff of the county.
